subject: Gardening
title: Keukenhof: The Flower Exhibition
description: A micro-lesson that makes Keukenhof: The Flower Exhibition usable.

hook.text: Every spring, 7 million flower bulbs bloom in eight weeks at Keukenhof. Then it closes for the year.

buildup.text: Keukenhof in the Netherlands opens for only two monthsâ€”mid-March to mid-Mayâ€”timed to the tulip season.

discovery.text: Originally a 15th-century herb garden for a countess, 'Keukenhof' literally means 'kitchen garden.'

twist.text: The garden started in 1949 as a trade show for Dutch flower growers. Tourism was an afterthought that took over.

climax.text: Keukenhof draws 1.5 million visitors in its brief seasonâ€”making it the most intensely visited garden on Earth.

punchline.text: The world's most visited garden is open 8 weeks a year.

quiz.question: Why is Keukenhof only open for about eight weeks each year?
options: The garden floods during other seasons due to its low elevation
It is timed to the spring tulip bloom season
Restoration work requires 10 months of annual maintenance
